data.comment:
The navigator interface is used by the navigator to export information about the current status of the navigator and to define all messages by which the navigator can be instructed.
There are three coordinate systems, the robot system which is a right-handed cartesian coordinate system with the robot in its origin, X axis pointing forward, Y pointing to the left and Z pointing upwards. The second coordinate system is the so-called navigator system. It is a coordinate system similar to the robot system, but the origin is defined on the initialization of the navigator. The last system is the odometry system. It is again a similar system, but the origin is reset from time to time and the robot's position in this system gives the odometry deltas.

message.name: Stop
message.field:
If zero, stops any motion. If non-zero, the component shall only stop the motion if the currently executed command was received through a message with that specific ID.
Use the specific version whenever possible. It avoids a race condition if one intstructing component sends a stop, and another a new drive command at the same time.

message.name: Turn
message.comment: Turn around own major axis. Opposed to setting a goto with a target angle this message causes the robot to turn exactly by this angle, it will not normalize it and turn to a specified angle.
message.field: The desired turning velocity in rad/s, set to zero to use default value.

message.name: ResetOdometry
message.comment: Resets the origin of the odometry system

message.name: SetMaxVelocity
message.comment: States the maximum velocity of the robot for driving/walking, but not for turning.

message.name: SetMaxRotation
message.comment: States the maximum velocity of the robot for rotating/turning.

message.name: SetEscaping
message.comment: Sets if escaping is allowed (true) or not (false).

message.name: SetSecurityDistance
message.comment: Sets the desired security distance (in meters) for collision avoidance.

message.name: SetDriveMode
message.comment: Sets the desired drive modefor collision avoidance.

message.name: ResetParameters
message.comment: Reset the settable parameters to default values.
